head.title: Arts, Briefly; Skull for Sale, With Diamonds

hedline.hl1: Arts, Briefly; Skull for Sale, With Diamonds

body.head.byline: By ALAN RIDING; Compiled by Peter Edidin

block.p: A human skull cast in platinum and covered with 8,601 diamonds, weighing 1,106.18 carats, went on view yesterday at the London gallery of its creator, the British artist Damien Hirst. The gallery, White Cube, said the skull cost $23.5 million to make and is being offered for $98 million. Timothy Marlow, the gallery's director of exhibitions, said that three collectors had shown interest in buying it. The bejeweled skull, presented in a dark room under a single spotlight, is called ''For the Love of God'' and is part of ''Beyond Belief,'' a larger show of Mr. Hirst's recent work being presented through July 7 at White Cube's Mayfair and Hoxton Square galleries.
